hero.title: Mountain Trail Challenge 2023
hero.subtitle: Experience the ultimate trail running competition in the heart of nature

highlights.title: Event Highlights
highlights.dateDescription: Three days of challenging races across beautiful mountain trails
highlights.categoriesDescription: From 10K sprint to 80K ultra, suitable for all experience levels
highlights.prizeDescription: Compete for substantial prizes across multiple categories

testimonials.title: What Participants Say
testimonials.quote1: One of the most challenging and beautiful courses I've ever run. The organization was top-notch and the views were incredible!
testimonials.quote2: Perfect combination of technical terrain and smooth trails. Will definitely be coming back next year with more friends!
testimonials.quote3: My first trail race and I'm hooked! The aid stations were well-stocked and the volunteers were so encouraging.

rules.title: Rules
rules.subtitle: Competition rules and regulations
rules.importantDescription: All participants must abide by these rules to ensure a safe and fair competition for everyone.
rules.introduction: The following rules have been established to ensure the safety of all participants and to maintain the integrity of the competition. Please read them carefully.

general.title: General Rules
general.item1: Participants must be at least 18 years old on race day.
general.item2: Registration is personal and cannot be transferred to another person.
general.item3: Bibs must be visible at all times during the race.
general.item4: Participants must follow the marked course at all times.
general.item5: The race director's decisions are final.

equipment.title: Required Equipment
equipment.item1: Mobile phone with emergency numbers saved (provided at registration).
equipment.item2: Water container with minimum capacity of 1 liter (ultra races) or 500ml (others).
equipment.item4: Weather-appropriate clothing (details provided closer to race day).

conduct.title: Participant Conduct
conduct.item1: Littering on the course is strictly prohibited. Use designated waste bins at aid stations.
conduct.item2: Respect other participants, staff, volunteers, and the environment.
conduct.item3: Help fellow participants in emergency situations.
conduct.item4: The use of personal music players with headphones is discouraged for safety reasons.

safety.title: Safety Procedures
safety.item1: Medical checks may be performed at various points during the race.
safety.item2: Participants showing signs of excessive fatigue or injury may be stopped by medical staff.
safety.item3: In case of emergency, contact race officials or use the emergency number provided.
safety.item4: Race officials may suspend or cancel the race due to extreme weather conditions.

environment.title: Environmental Protection
environment.item1: Stay on marked trails to prevent soil erosion and damage to vegetation.
environment.item2: Do not disturb wildlife or damage plant life.
environment.item3: Pack in, pack out - carry all your trash until you can dispose of it properly.

notes.title: Important Notes
notes.note1: Schedule may be subject to slight adjustments based on weather conditions.
notes.note2: All participants must check in at least 1 hour before their race start time.
notes.note3: Bib collection is only available during the designated check-in times on Day 1.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.q1: How do I modify my registration?
faq.a1: You can modify your registration by logging into your account on our website. If you don't have an account, please contact us directly at info@trailrunpro.com with your request.
faq.q2: What happens if the event is canceled due to weather?
faq.a2: If we need to cancel the event due to severe weather conditions, participants will be offered either a full refund or priority registration for next year's event.
faq.q3: Are there age restrictions for the races?
faq.a3: Yes, participants must be at least 18 years old for the Ultra 80K and Marathon categories. For the Half Marathon, 25K, and 10K races, participants must be at least 16 years old with parental consent.
faq.q4: What aid stations will be available on the course?
faq.a4: Aid stations are positioned approximately every 5-10km depending on the race category. All stations provide water, electrolytes, and basic food. Major aid stations (marked on race maps) also provide more substantial nutrition options.
faq.q5: Can I bring a support crew?
faq.a5: Support crews are allowed but can only assist runners at designated aid stations. Crew access points will be marked on maps provided in the race package.

sponsors.title: Sponsors
sponsors.subtitle: Our valued partners and supporters
sponsors.becomeASponsorText: Join us in supporting the trail running community. We offer various sponsorship packages to suit different marketing objectives and budgets.

gold.title: Gold Package
gold.benefit1: Large logo placement on all event materials
gold.benefit2: Premium booth location at the event expo

silver.title: Silver Package
silver.benefit1: Medium logo placement on event materials

bronze.title: Bronze Package
bronze.benefit1: Small logo placement on event materials

sponsor1.description: Leading provider of high-performance trail running gear and equipment.

sponsor2.description: Premium natural energy drinks specially formulated for endurance athletes.

sponsor3.description: Innovative GPS and tracking technology designed for trail runners.

sponsor4.description: Outdoor clothing and gear retailer specializing in hiking and trail running.

sponsor5.description: Professional training programs and coaching for trail runners of all levels.

sponsor6.description: Fitness magazine dedicated to outdoor and trail sports.
